medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presents with 2 days of abdominal pain, described as a dull ache in the right lower quadrant (RLQ), which has been unchanged. No fever, chills, nausea/vomiting, or anorexia reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Tuberous sclerosis, bilateral spontaneous pneumothorax treated with talc pleurodesis, sinusitis, anxiety, seizure disorder, impaired renal function, hypertension. Past surgical history includes bilateral partial nephrectomies for kidney tumors, splenectomy, and cholecystectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandfather and grandmother both with lung cancer; no family history of tuberous sclerosis.
